name: Ada Lovelace
description: English mathematician; wrote notes on Babbage's Analytical Engine and is often credited with the first algorithm intended to be carried out by a machine.

name: Alan Turings
description: British mathematician and logician; founding figure in theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence; led cryptanalysis work at Bletchley Park during WWII.

name: Grace Hopper
description: American computer scientist and U.S. Navy rear admiral; pioneer of programming languages and compiler development, and influential in the creation and adoption of COBOL.

name: Donald Knuth
description: American computer scientist and professor emeritus at Stanford; author of 'The Art of Computer Programming' and a pioneer in algorithms and analysis of algorithms.

name: Margaret Hamilton
description: American software engineer who led the team that developed on-board flight software for NASA's Apollo missions; promoted the term 'software engineering'.

name: Ken Thompson
description: American computer scientist; co-creator of the Unix operating system and early programming languages and tools at Bell Labs.

name: Dennis Ritchie
description: American computer scientist; creator of the C programming language and co-developer of the Unix operating system.

name: Edsger W. Dijkstra
description: Dutch computer scientist; made fundamental contributions to algorithms, structured programming, and programming language design (Dijkstra's algorithm).

name: Fred Brooks
description: American computer architect and software engineer; managed development of IBM System/360 and wrote 'The Mythical Man-Month' on software project management.

name: Barbara Liskov
description: American computer scientist; Turing Award laureate known for work on programming languages, data abstraction, and distributed systems (Liskov substitution principle).

name: Linus Torvalds
description: Software engineer who created the Linux operating system. He's really cool and I really like him
